gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Annex III. INSPIRE Dataset for Area management / restriction / regulation zones & reporting units Theme

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: INSPIRE dataset for Area Management/Restriction/Regulation Zones and Reporting Units theme represents theme-related territories in Lithuania. Data of mineral resources restriction zones are not public, in order to get these data you need to contact the Lithuanian geological survey under the Ministry of Environment which is the resource provider, lgt@lgt.lt The AM.DrinkingWaterProtectionArea layer is shown at a scale of 1:500 000 through the view service.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Lithuanian geological survey under the Ministry of Environment
Center for Health Education and Diseases Prevention

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Area management/restriction/regulation zones and reporting units
Nitrate vulnerable zones - nutrient sensitive areas (Water Framework Directive)
Drinking water protection areas (Water Framework Directive)
Major roads, railways and air transport network (Noise Directive)
Management zones and agglomerations (Air Quality Directive)

Water Body under the Water Framework Directive (2000/60/EC)

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: This data set is conformant with the INSPIRE Implementing Rules for the interoperability of spatial data sets and services

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: INSPIRE dataset for Area Management/Restriction/Regulation Zones and Reporting Units theme is created using input data sets: 1) landfills and waste collections (source of data – Spatial data set of (geo) reference base cadastre (GRPK)), data provider – the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Lithuania; 2) noise zones of agglomerations, 3) main roads, and 4) railways, data provider – the Ministry of Health of The Republic of Lithuania; 5) plant health zones, data provider – the State Plant Service; 6) Sea region, data provider – the Coastal Research and Planning Institute of Klaipeda University; 7) air quality management zones and agglomerations, 8) river basins, and 9) nitrate sensitive areas, data provider – the Environmental Protection Agency; 10) bathing places, data provider – the Center for Health Education and Disease Prevention; 11) protected areas for drinking water, 12) karst areas (data source – the Map of Lithuania's karst zone boundaries 1:50,000), 13) mineral resources, and 14) underground water resources, data provider – Lithuanian Geological Survey under the Ministry of Environment of Lithuania; 15) forest management zones, data provider – the State Forest Service. The output data set is created by State Enterprise GIS-Centras, Lithuania.
